info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 27 at 10:21AM CDT until June 29 at 8:43AM CDT by NWS La Crosse WI
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in La Crosse WI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Iowa...
Cedar River at Charles City affecting Floyd County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cedar River at Charles City.
* WHEN...From Saturday morning to Sunday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Barricading of streets begins, and the intersection of Riverside and North Illinois Streets may be flooded. Cable pedestrian bridge is closed.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 12.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.1 feet on 03/07/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse.
The next statement will be issued this evening by 1030 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING TO SUNDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH
